title: 110+ Short Positive Messages & Quotes for Cancer Patients

steps.title: Help keep their spirits lifted with an encouraging message.
steps.content: Help keep their spirits lifted with an encouraging message. One of the biggest mistakes some people make when a friend or loved one receives a cancer diagnosis is to say nothing. [1] X Research source Cancer is scary for everyone, but even a short note of support and encouragement can make a huge difference to someone going through treatment. Try sending one of these encouraging messages: Hope may be elusive, but it‚Äôs always there. Keep holding on‚Äîwe‚Äôll get through this together. Remember that it's okay to have tough days. Even during these days, you're still moving forward. I‚Äôm so glad you‚Äôre a part of my life. I look forward to doing all I can to support you. Cancer may have underestimated your indomitable spirit. Stand tall, for you have the power to overcome any obstacle. I care about you. I hope each day something makes you smile. Cancer cannot cripple love, cannot shatter hope, cannot conquer the spirit. You are not facing cancer alone. We will get through this together. The road may be long, but your strength, faith, and determination will carry you through. No matter the diagnosis, you are important, you are loved, and you continue to make a difference every single day. Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and shadows will fall behind you. Cancer begins with ‚Äúcan.‚Äù I believe you can do this, and I‚Äôm here for you. There will be ups and downs, but every step you take is progress. Each day is a step closer to healing. You are not alone‚Äîyour support system is here for you. Take the time you need to heal, and always remember that you are surrounded by love and support.

steps.title: Give them a well-need chuckle with a funny message.
steps.content: Give them a well-need chuckle with a funny message. Making a joke might feel strange when facing a serious illness like cancer. But humor is a healthy coping mechanism that helps our fears seem less overwhelming. [2] X Research source ‚ÄúSend supportive notes, cards, and e-mails. These might include jokes and stories that will help lift their spirits,‚Äù says Anbar. Here are a few lighthearted and funny messages to make them smile: I bought you these healing crystals. I don‚Äôt think they actually do anything, but they‚Äôre pretty, and they make great weapons. The only thing I know more stubborn than cancer is you. It's one of your best qualities, and it's your secret weapon. Chemo sucks. But if it sucks the cancer out of you, then‚Ä¶ yay! I have to admit. I‚Äôm kind of impressed at your body‚Äôs ability to grow things in inappropriate locations. Losing your hair during chemo just means you have one less thing to mess with in the morning. They say laughter is the best medicine. Unless you have cancer, in which case chemotherapy is much more effective. There really are no good words for this situation‚Ä¶except swear words. Lots of swear words. As if cancer stands a chance against you! It‚Äôs clearly picked the wrong person to mess with. Just think, you get to take medication that‚Äôs more expensive than a month‚Äôs salary. So lux. I know you are worried about losing your hair, but it can‚Äôt make you look any worse than that at-home perm your mom gave you in 10th grade! There‚Äôs, like, a small chance radiation will give you superpowers. So There‚Äôs that. Well, there is one positive thing to your diagnosis: Now you can play the cancer card! You‚Äôre on the road to recovery, and I‚Äôll be riding shotgun! Now, when someone complains about their bad hair day, you can shut them down every time.

steps.title: Share a message of faith to give them comfort.
steps.content: Share a message of faith to give them comfort. Religious messages or Bible quotes can be extremely comforting to people of faith. It can help them lower stress levels, feel connected to others, and heal in both body and spirit. [3] X Research source Try one of these faith-filled messages and Bible quotes to offer your support in their time of need: Fear not, for I am with you, be not dismayed, for I am your God: I will strengthen you, I will help you, I will uphold you with my victorious right hand. ‚Äì Isaiah 41:10 Always remember that God is your helper and protector. I will continue to pray that He restores your good health. For I will restore health unto you, and I will heal you of your wounds, says the Lord. ‚Äì Jeremiah 30:17a May the peace and comfort of God surround you during this challenging time. There is power in faith. Have faith that God will watch over you and protect you. May God strengthen your heart and be the answer to all your needs. Keep the faith‚Äî faith in God, faith in your doctors, faith in yourself. One day at a time. May God hold you up and give you the strength to go through each day as you fight this battle. Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord. ‚Äì Psalm 31:24 I am praying that you find strength in the Lord and his never-ending supply of love as you undergo treatment. May the hand of the Lord rest upon you as you recover from your recent surgery and heal. I will say of the Lord; he is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust. ‚Äì Psalm 91:1,2 While we cannot see God, we can know of His faithfulness to us during the hard times as well as the good. Whenever God brings you to something, He makes sure that He will bring you through it. One day at a time, one step at a time. Do what you can. Do your best. Let your creator handle the rest.

steps.content: Use a famous comforting quote to help give them hope. Cancer is a heavy subject that‚Äôs difficult for many people to talk about. It‚Äôs a mindset. ‚Äì Dave Pelzer Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and shadows will fall behind you. ‚Äì Walt Whitman To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering. ‚Äì Friedrich Nietzsche What lies behind you and what lies in front of you pales in comparison to what lies inside of you. ‚Äì Ralph Waldo Emerson Success is not final; failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts. ‚ÄìWinston Churchill It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light. ‚Äì Aristotle Believe you can, and you're halfway there. ‚Äì President Theodore Roosevelt Once you choose hope, anything‚Äôs possible. ‚Äì Christopher Reeve Always remember you are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, smarter than you think, and loved more than you know. ‚Äì A. A. Milne Each day is a gift. That is why they call it ‚Äúpresent.‚Äù ‚Äì Eleanor Roosevelt Nothing is impossible. The word itself says I‚Äôm possible! ‚Äì Audrey Hepburn Out of a mountain of despair, a stone of hope. ‚Äì Dr Martin Luther King Jr. I am not this hair; I am not this skin; I am the soul that lives within. ‚Äì Rumi Don‚Äôt count the days. Roosevelt

steps.title: Let your co-worker know you‚Äôre rooting for them with a supportive note.
steps.content: Let your co-worker know you‚Äôre rooting for them with a supportive note. Knowing what to say to a co-worker with cancer can be even more difficult than communicating with a friend or family member because you may not know them as well. However, a positive message can still help them feel connected to their work community. Here are a few options you can use for cards and other messages for your work colleagues: May your journey be filled with swift healing and a future brimming with joy and renewed vitality. Wishing you strength, peace, and healing during this trying journey. You are in my prayers I‚Äôll be thinking about you. I hope each day brings a little more strength, determination, and healing your way. Remember, progress is not always measured by leaps and bounds, but by the determination and perseverance you display every day. You and your family are in my thoughts. Here‚Äôs to you‚ÄîI hope that you get steadier, stronger, and better every day. Allow yourself to rest, rejuvenate, and let your body work its miraculous magic. We eagerly await the day when we can celebrate your triumphant return! I hope you have a very speedy recovery! I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre going through this. I want you to know I‚Äôm cheering you on. Sending healing vibes and warm wishes for a speedy recovery. Your strength and resilience will guide you through this challenging time. Wishing you strength and health and a speedy recovery! I just want you to know you are in my thoughts every day. We‚Äôre always here to support you. With each sunrise comes renewed hope and strength. Know that I‚Äôm cheering you on from afar.

steps.title: Send a thoughtful note to support families and caretakers.
steps.content: Send a thoughtful note to support families and caretakers. Families and caretakers of cancer patients need support, too. They might be stressed and trying to balance their regular responsibilities with new ones. They may also be dealing with some of the same emotions the cancer patient is facing. [4] X Research source Let them know you‚Äôre there for them with a thoughtful message like the ones below. Your love and care make all the difference. When someone we love is suffering, our love heals their hearts and calms their souls. Please be kind to yourself. You‚Äôre taking on a lot right now. Let me know if you need a break. It‚Äôs not the strength of the body that counts, but the strength of the spirit. ‚Äì J.R.R. Tolkien I‚Äôm so sorry that you have to go through this. You have been keeping up a brave front, but I wanted to make sure that you know I am here for you. Your strength as a family is truly inspiring. Together, you can face anything that comes your way. You never know how strong you are until being strong is your only choice. ‚Äì Bob Marley I‚Äôve seen how great you are with trying to handle everything, but you deserve some ‚Äúme time‚Äù for yourself. Let me take you for a pedicure. You are the rock they lean on‚Äînever underestimate your strength.

steps.title: Show a kid with cancer you care with an age-appropriate message.
steps.content: Show a kid with cancer you care with an age-appropriate message. Talking to kids about their cancer diagnosis can be tough, but it‚Äôs important to be helpful, accurate, and truthful. It‚Äôs also important for them to stay connected with their friends and family members during their treatment. [5] X Trustworthy Source National Cancer Institute An agency in the National Institutes of Health focused on cancer research and patient support Go to source Use one of these phrases to help you know what to say to a kid you care about who‚Äôs dealing with cancer: I wish only good things for you and your family. Is the medicine that the doctors and nurses are giving you making you feel better? I hope so because we can‚Äôt wait until you are home again! A superhero is someone who faces tough times with the bravest heart. Psst‚Ä¶that‚Äôs you! I wish I could take this pain away for you. So many people are cheering you on! You‚Äôre smart, brave, and very, very loved. Hang in there! The littlest people sometimes face the biggest challenges with incredible grace. I‚Äôm sorry you are feeling icky right now. We hope that cuddling this new teddy bear will help you feel a little better! Not knowing what the future holds can be scary, and I'm in awe of your strength. You‚Äôre surrounded by love, and we are all rooting for you. No one is strong until they have to be, and I see the strength in you. I know you aren‚Äôt feeling well, kiddo, but I wanted you to know that you are the bravest kid I know. Being scared or sad doesn't mean you aren't the bravest person in the room. You are. My greatest wish is for you to be well again, and I‚Äôm going to help you get there. I‚Äôm sorry you are going through this. It really sucks.

steps.title: Some well-meaning comments may not be helpful to a cancer patient.
steps.content: Some well-meaning comments may not be helpful to a cancer patient. There are common statements many people rely on when they aren‚Äôt really sure what to say. But these phrases can come off as insensitive or trite. In most cases, it‚Äôs better to just be honest and say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure what to say.‚Äù Then tell them you care about them. [6] X Research source Here are a few unhelpful phrases cancer patients hear and what to say instead: ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt even look sick.‚Äù Instead, say something like, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry you have to go through this, but I‚Äôm here if you want to talk.‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll be fine.‚Äù Instead, say something like, ‚ÄúHow are you feeling today? I‚Äôm here to listen.‚Äù ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the good cancer.‚Äù Instead, say something like, ‚ÄúI want you to know I love you, and I‚Äôm going to be here with you every step of the way.‚Äù ‚ÄúEverything happens for a reason.‚Äù Instead, say something like, ‚ÄúI just wanted to let you know that I care about you.‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôve heard that ‚ÄòX‚Äô cures cancer.‚Äù Instead, say something like, ‚ÄúHave you and your doctor decided on a care plan? Do you need help getting to appointments?‚Äù ‚ÄúYou are so strong and brave.‚Äù Instead, say something like, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry you have to go through this, but I‚Äôm here to help you be strong.‚Äù

steps.title: Be a good listener when they need to talk.
steps.content: Be a good listener when they need to talk. Letting a cancer patient know you are there for them and ready to listen when they want to talk is one of the best things you can do to support them. ‚ÄúAsk if they would like to talk about their illness. If so, listen rather than offering to help solve their problem,‚Äù says Anbar. Tell them you know they may not want to talk, but you‚Äôll be there when they do. Be an active listener by giving them your full attention without interruptions. Show you‚Äôre listening by maintaining eye contact and responding to what they say with nods and appropriate facial expressions. If they pause, ask questions to confirm what they‚Äôve said or get clarification like, "So, you'll be going for treatment three days a week, right? Will you have a set schedule, or will it vary?" ‚ÄúAnd sometimes it's just not saying anything,‚Äù says House. They might just need someone to sit with them.

steps.title: Acknowledge and validate what they‚Äôre feeling.
steps.content: Acknowledge and validate what they‚Äôre feeling. Being diagnosed with cancer can cause a range of emotions. Let them know that whatever it is they‚Äôre feeling is perfectly understandable. Try not to jump immediately to cheering them up, which can feel dismissive. Anbar says, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt say you understand how they feel, as each person‚Äôs feelings are different.‚Äù Let them feel what they feel. If they‚Äôre sad or scared, a good cry might really help them work through their emotions. [7] X Research source It can be upsetting to see someone you care about deal with their emotions, but staying strong and being there for them is a great way to offer your support even if you don‚Äôt say a word. Acknowledge their feelings by repeating what they‚Äôve said to show you‚Äôve heard them. For example, say something like, "I hear you saying that you're scared you won't be around to see your son graduate. I can‚Äôt imagine how terrifying that is, but I‚Äôm here to listen whenever you need me."

steps.title: Offer to help in specific ways.
steps.content: Offer to help in specific ways. We‚Äôre often told to ask, ‚ÄúHow can I help?‚Äù in these situations, but it might be more helpful to think about what they might need at that moment, says House. People don‚Äôt always know what they need or may feel uncomfortable asking for something. Help them out by offering to do specific tasks like giving them a ride to their doctor's appointment or picking up their prescriptions. Anbar adds, ‚ÄúYou might offer to help with daily life activities such as making a meal, vacuuming, shopping, or providing transportation.‚Äù If you offer to help them, make sure you follow through to show you really are there to support them. And if you know you don‚Äôt have time to do something, offer to do something else. However, sometimes people don‚Äôt want help. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt repeatedly offer help that they reject, as this will cause them to feel unheard or disrespected,‚Äù says Anbar.
